content.narrative: Hospital debe cumplir: HIPAA (federal law - PHI), PCI-DSS (payment cards), GDPR (pacientes EU), state breach laws, NIST CSF (voluntary pero board lo requiere), HITRUST (certification para seguros). Cada framework overlap pero diferencias clave. Implementan NIST CSF como base, mapean otros frameworks. Gap analysis revela 50+ controles faltantes. $5M investment en 2 años.

content.intro: Voluntary framework para mejorar ciberseguridad en critical infrastructure. Adoptado por empresas de todos tamaños.

tabs.label: 5 Functions
tabs.title: Core Functions
tabs.text: IDENTIFY (asset management, risk assessment), PROTECT (access control, training), DETECT (monitoring, anomalies), RESPOND (incident response, communications), RECOVER (recovery planning, improvements). Organizan actividades en ciclo completo.

tabs.label: Implementation Tiers
tabs.title: Madurez Organizacional
tabs.text: Tier 1 Partial (reactive, ad-hoc), Tier 2 Risk Informed (risk-aware, no formal), Tier 3 Repeatable (formal policies, regular updates), Tier 4 Adaptive (proactive, continuous improvement). Organización evalúa current tier y define target.

tabs.label: Profiles
tabs.title: Current vs Target State
tabs.text: Current Profile: estado actual de implementación. Target Profile: estado deseado según risk appetite y business needs. Gap analysis: diferencia entre current y target. Roadmap para cerrar gaps.

tabs.label: Categories & Subcategories
tabs.title: Detalle Específico
tabs.text: 23 Categories (ej: Asset Management, Data Security, Incident Response). 108 Subcategories con outcomes específicos. Ej: PR.AC-1: Identities and credentials issued, managed, verified, revoked, audited. Mapea a NIST 800-53, ISO 27001, CIS Controls.

key_requirements: Lawful basis for processing (consent, legitimate interest)
Right to access, rectification, erasure, portability
Data breach notification 72 hours to authority
DPO (Data Protection Officer) for certain orgs
Privacy by design and by default
DPIA (Data Protection Impact Assessment) for high-risk

Privacy Rule: Use/disclosure limits, patient rights
Breach Notification Rule: 60 days to HHS and affected
12 Requirements: Firewall, encryption, access control, monitoring, testing, policies

key_requirements: IT controls relevant: access control, change management, backups
regulations.penalties: CEO/CFO certification required, jail time for fraud

content.note: ISO 27001 es estándar de pago (no free/public como NIST). Aquí conceptos generales.
content.overview: International standard para ISMS (Information Security Management System). Certifiable - auditor externo certifica compliance.
content.isms_process: Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) cycle: Plan (establish ISMS, risk assessment), Do (implement controls), Check (monitor, audit), Act (improve).
content.annex_a: 114 controles organizados en 14 domains: A.5 Policies, A.6 Organization, A.7 Human Resources, A.8 Asset Management, A.9 Access Control, A.10 Cryptography, A.11 Physical Security, A.12 Operations, A.13 Communications, A.14 Development, A.15 Supplier, A.16 Incident, A.17 Continuity, A.18 Compliance.
content.vs_nist: ISO 27001 es certifiable standard. NIST CSF/800-53 son guidelines (no certification official). Muchos controles overlap - se complementan.

content.challenge: Organización sujeta a múltiples frameworks. Overlap significativo pero diferencias clave. Cómo gestionar?

strategy.approach: Implement comprehensive framework (NIST CSF o ISO 27001) como base. Mapear otros requerimientos a ese framework. Identificar gaps únicos de cada regulación.
strategy.example_mapping: NIST CSF PR.AC-1 (identity management) mapea a: ISO 27001 A.9.2.1, HIPAA 164.308(a)(4), PCI-DSS 8.1, GDPR Article 32(1). Implementar una vez, cumplir múltiples.

gap_analysis_process: 2. Mapear requerimientos a framework base elegido
3. Identificar gaps: controles requeridos por regulación pero no en framework base
4. Priorizar gaps por: criticality, regulatory penalty, effort
5. Create roadmap para cerrar gaps (quick wins + long-term)

common_gaps.gdpr_specific: DPIA process, Data retention policies, Right to erasure automation
common_gaps.hipaa_specific: BAA management, PHI encryption at rest (not just transit), Audit logs 6 years
common_gaps.pci_specific: Quarterly ASV scans, Segmentation of CDE, Compensating controls documentation

content.tools: GRC (Governance Risk Compliance) platforms: ServiceNow GRC, OneTrust, LogicGate. Automated control mapping y evidence collection.

content.scenario: Fintech startup. Necesita: PCI-DSS (payment processing), GDPR (EU customers), SOX (planning IPO).
content.your_task: Usar NIST CSF como base, identificar gaps para PCI y GDPR.

step_1.assessment: Rate cada CSF Subcategory 0-4 scale (0=not implemented, 4=fully implemented)

step_2.business_drivers: PCI compliance (required), GDPR (legal requirement), SOX (planned IPO in 18 months)

types.who: Internal audit team or hired consultant
types.purpose: Self-assessment, identify gaps before external audit

types.frequency: Annual for certifications (ISO, SOC 2), as required for compliance
types.purpose: Validate compliance, provide assurance to stakeholders
types.output: Audit report, certification (if pass), findings to remediate

audit_process: 2. Fieldwork: interviews, document review, technical testing
5. Final report: certification or findings to fix
content.evidence_collection: Screenshots, policies, logs, training records, meeting minutes, change tickets, vulnerability scans, penetration test reports. Organize evidence in advance.
content.soc_2: Service Organization Control 2. Audit de controles para service providers (SaaS). Type 1 (point in time) vs Type 2 (over period, 6-12 months). Trust Service Criteria: Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, Privacy.

content.question: Startup SaaS en EU, procesa pagos. ¿Qué frameworks/regulations aplicables mínimo?

options.text: Solo GDPR porque están en EU
options.feedback: No. Procesan pagos → PCI-DSS también. Posiblemente ISO 27001 para customer trust.

options.text: GDPR (EU data), PCI-DSS (payment cards), considerar ISO 27001 o SOC 2 para customers
options.feedback: Correcto. GDPR es legal requirement. PCI-DSS es contractual (card brands). ISO/SOC 2 no mandatory pero customers enterprise lo piden.
NIST CSF es voluntary, útil como base pero no requirement. GDPR y PCI son mandatory.
